J. Hastings Batson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Hastings_Batson 0 Abraham John Hastings Batson (8 November 1841 – 18 April 1921), usually credited as J. Hastings Batson, was an English stage actor of the Victorian and Edwardian era who went on to become a character actor in silent movies. Batson was born in Clerkenwell, London, in 1841. In October 1881 he played Iago in Othello, at Kilburn Town Hall, and was credited as John Hastings Batson.In 1908 and 1909 he was a member of the Executive Committee of the Actors' Union, founded in 1907.Batson played the leading role in The German Spy Peril (1914), a silent war propaganda film based loosely on the Guy Fawkes plot of 1605, with German spies planning to blow up the Houses of Parliament.He died in the West Middlesex Hospital, Isleworth, Middlesex, on 18 April 1921, aged 79, leaving effects worth £50. At the time of his death his address was 26, Mountfield Road, Ealing. Abraham_John_Hastings_Batson ( 8_November_1841 – 18_April_1921 ) , usually_credited as J._Hastings_Batson , was an_English_stage_actor of the_Victorian_and_Edwardian_era who went on to_become a_character_actor in silent_movies . Batson was_born in Clerkenwell , London , in 1841 . In October_1881 he played Iago in Othello , at Kilburn_Town_Hall , and was_credited as John_Hastings_Batson.In_1908 and 1909 he was a_member of the_Executive_Committee of the_Actors '_Union , founded in 1907 . Batson played the_leading_role in The_German_Spy_Peril_(_1914_) , a_silent_war_propaganda_film based loosely on the_Guy_Fawkes_plot of 1605 , with German_spies planning_to_blow up the_Houses of Parliament.He died in the_West_Middlesex_Hospital , Isleworth , Middlesex , on 18_April_1921 , aged 79 , leaving effects worth £_50 . At the_time of his_death his_address was 26 , Mountfield_Road , Ealing .
